form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve access to medical services for veterans seeking treatment at Department of Veterans Affairs outpatient clinics with exceptionally long waiting periods.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans Outpatient Care Access Act of 2007.

section.header: Access to medical services for veterans seeking treatment at Department of Veterans Affairs outpatient clinics with exceptionally long waiting periods

subsection.text: Section 1710 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

In the case of an outpatient clinic of the Department at which the waiting period for treatment of patients is six months or longer, the Secretary shall, for any veteran seeking medical services at that clinic who is informed by the clinic that the veteran will have such a waiting period, provide for the provision of needed medical services for that veteran from sources outside the Department. Provision of such services shall be under the same terms and conditions with respect to eligibility and copayments (if any) as apply if such services were provided directly by the Secretary through the clinic. The Secretary shall prescribe such regulations as necessary to carry out this subsection.
Subsection (i) of section 1710 of title 38, United States Code, as added by subsection (a), shall take effect at the end of the 90-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act.
